alert.note: Alert for Socorro (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 3:27PM MDT until August 02 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE BEAR TRAP BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL SOCORRO COUNTY... At 327 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated the thunderstorms that produced moderate to heavy rain over the Bear Trap burn scar have departed the area. However, additional storms to the north may drift over the burn scar through 430 PM MDT. Between 0.50 and 1.25 inches of rain have already fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.50 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Big Pigeon Canyon, Little Pigeon Canyon, Whitewater Canyon, and West Red Canyon downstream to Alamosa Creek and State Road 52. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding and debris flows are likely due to the heavy rainfall over the burn scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding and property damage are possible. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dusty. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. To report flooding, contact your local law enforcement agency and your National Weather Service office when you can do so safely.
